title: Process Isolation and phpunit.phar install
body:
While using phpunit with the phar distribution, some project cannot resolve PHPUnit/Autoload.php file as the file does not exist in the include path.

Here an error:

```
The error is 9) JMS\SecurityExtraBundle\Tests\Functional\TwigIntegrationTest::testIsExprGranted
PHPUnit_Framework_Exception: PHP Warning:  require(PHPUnit/Autoload.php): failed to open stream: No such file or directory in - on line 9
Warning: require(PHPUnit/Autoload.php): failed to open stream: No such file or directory in - on line 9
PHP Fatal error:  require(): Failed opening required 'PHPUnit/Autoload.php' (include_path='.:/usr/share/php:/usr/bin/phpunit') in - on line 9
Fatal error: require(): Failed opening required 'PHPUnit/Autoload.php' (include_path='.:/usr/share/php:/usr/bin/phpunit') in - on line 9

```

The test is using 

```
        $client = $this->createClient(array('config' => 'all_voters_disabled.yml'));
        $client->insulate();
```

The insulate method make the Client (Symfony2) create a dedicated process to run the test, which fail to include the `PHPUnit/Autoload.php` file.

I tried different solutions with the default include path: (include_path='.:/usr/share/php:phar:///usr/bin/phpunit/') ... but with no luck ...

Does it mean there is no solution if a phar cannot be in a include_path ? So the only valid installation solution for PHPUnit is by using the Pear install.
